metadata.title: CVE-2023-3772 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s IP framework for transformingpackets (XFRM subsystem). This issue may allow a malicious user withCAP_NET_ADMIN privileges to directly dereference a NULL pointer inxfrm_update_ae_params(), leading to a possible kernel crash and denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-lowlatency - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-aws - 4.4.0-1124.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1171-azure - 4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.130').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1').
